p:
Of the cases reported to WHO, 20.8% had mild to no symptoms while 46.5% had severe disease or died.
21 MERS is typically more severe in those with other health problems, more than half of the reported cases had had comorbidities (eg, diabetes mellitus, hypertension, heart disease, chronic renal failure, or lung disease), which might explain the high mortality rate.
20 ,
21 The overall risk of death may be lower than reported as those with mild symptoms may be undiagnosed.
24
